comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: This photograph was taken between 31 January 1889 and 1895 inclusive. See 2009 comparison photograph here: www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy/3165638066/ For information on dating the State Records NSW photograph, see here: lifeasdaddy.typepad.com/lifeasdaddy/2009/01/sydney-then-a... Added: 2009 view: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy/3165638066/]

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
Your photos make for a very complimentary "now and then" theme. 

We appreciate your research into this image. I have added a rough date above and we will amend Photo Investigator.  

Thanks again!

comment._content: OK.  Thanks for your kind words.  I'm working on more.

comment.author: 49636853@N00
comment._content: Here's my first attempt at a "Now and Then" mashup using: the State Records [http://www.flickr.com/photos/state-records-nsw] photo and the one taken by [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lifeasdaddy] AB

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/lilahpops] Good job! They're tricky to line up, aren't they? Funny, I mustn't have paid proper attention before, as I was under the impression the clock had simply moved up into the tower. Now I realise it is an entirely different clock (and now I see your previous comment ...).

comment.author: 49636853@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thanks, they are tricky, which is probably why I hadn't tried it before :) I wonder...if there is more than one clock on the tower (sometimes there are four, aren't there?) then the original might be one of those...? AB
